title: Refraction - make a claim from Snells-law graph

content.question:
In an optics experiment, a beam of light travels across an interface between two transparent materials, Material <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Material <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Measurements are made of the following two quantities for a range of values.

The angle <math alttext="theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> between the normal to the interface and the beam in Material <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>

The angle <math alttext="theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> between the normal to the interface and the beam in Material <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>
As shown in the graph, <math alttext="the sine of theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is then plotted as a function of <math alttext="the sine of theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>sin</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements is consistent with the graph?

choices.label: Light has the same speed in both materials.

The refractive index is greater for Material <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> than for Material <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

The beam angles <math alttext="theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> are directly proportional to one another.

Total internal reflection is possible when light travels in Material <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> toward Material <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

content.answer: The refractive index is greater for Material <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> than for Material <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
